title: Don’t Publish Yet! Watch Me Research Amazon KDP Niches First

tactics.name: keyword_expansion
tactics.description: Use Amz Expander to generate keyword variations for niche research
steps: Input a base keyword into Amz Expander
Analyze generated keywords and their search volume
Cross-reference with Katie Spy for competition analysis
caveats: Requires manual validation of keyword relevance
source_quotes: Amz Expander automatically gives you keywords people are searching for

tactics.name: Series-Based Niche Expansion
tactics.description: Leverage niche subcategories by creating a series of books around a specific theme or audience (e.g., poetry prompts for twins, daily writing prompts).
steps: Identify undersaturated niches using Amazon Suggestion Expander
Create a series format (workbook, journal, daily prompts)
Optimize for first page rankings through strategic keywords
source_quotes: You can easily compete here for a first page ranking
Think in terms of how can you grab one niche and maybe turn it into uh something like this

tactics.name: research_low_popularity_niches
tactics.description: Identify niches with low keyword popularity but healthy competition for potential profitability
steps: Use Katie Spy to analyze keyword rankings
caveats: Requires consistent content quality to overcome low initial visibility
source_quotes: "This is an opportunity for you to explore this niche"

tactics.name: target_technology_related_anxieties
tactics.description: Focus on niches where tech dependency correlates with specific behavioral issues
steps: Map anxiety triggers to device reliance
caveats: Requires understanding of generational tech habits
source_quotes: "iPad kids show immense amounts of anxiety..."

tactics.name: subniche validation
tactics.description: Verify subniches within broader categories by analyzing search volume and competition
caveats: subniches may have lower search volume
source_quotes: this is a subniche and this is why I wanted to show you this

tactics.name: religious niche exploration
tactics.description: Identify opportunities in faith-based subniches with specific audience needs
source_quotes: Christian dating books. Okay. So, what we're going to do is we're going to click on Katie Spy Christ centered uh Christian dating

heuristics.name: low_competition_opportunity
heuristics.condition: If niche has low review counts but healthy competition
source_quotes: This niche isn't popular but has potential for revenue

heuristics.name: Low-Review Niche Optimization
heuristics.condition: If a niche has low popularity but first page ranking potential, prioritize it
source_quotes: Potential for revenue is rather low, but the competition it says you can rank on the first page

heuristics.name: prioritize_healthy_competition
heuristics.condition: If niche has low popularity but healthy competition, then it's a viable opportunity
source_quotes: "This is an opportunity for you to explore this niche"

heuristics.name: competition health check
heuristics.condition: If niche has 836-20000 BSR range with moderate competition, it's a viable opportunity
source_quotes: potential for revenue looks very good. Hey, competition is strong

claims.statement: First page rankings are critical for visibility in KDP
source_quotes: You want to rank on the first page

claims.statement: Undersaturated niches with series potential can achieve profitability through strategic formatting and marketing
source_quotes: If you do it correctly, if you do it in the form of a series, you can bring in some sales

claims.statement: Niche profitability can exist even with low keyword popularity if competition is healthy
source_quotes: "That series of books... had healthy competition... but I am selling those books"

claims.statement: Niche subcategories like 'dating a narcissist' show strong revenue potential with healthy competition
source_quotes: potential for revenue looks very good. Guess what? Competition is healthy

niche_patterns.description: Target underserved audiences with specific needs
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines niche identity with problem-solving potential
source_quotes: Books for teens tend to do really well
